subject: Cooking
title: We Eat With Our Eyes First
description: A 60-second lesson on We Eat With Our Eyes First.

hook.text: Dye white wine red and wine experts describe it using red wine vocabulary. Color overrules taste.

buildup.text: Vision is our dominant sense. Before a single bite, our brain has already decided if food is appealing.

discovery.text: Research shows people rate identical food as tastier when plated beautifully vs. dumped on a plate.

twist.text: Blue food is almost universally rejected â€” there are almost no naturally blue foods, so our brain flags it.

climax.text: Restaurant plating, Instagram food photography, and packaging design all exploit this visual dominance.

punchline.text: Flavor begins in the eyes, not the mouth.

quiz.question: Why do people generally reject blue-colored food?
options: Very few natural foods are blue
